sma: Simple moving average is the unweighted mean of the previous n data. Usualy used for steadily moving charts. FORMULA: SMA = (P1 + P2 + P3 + P4 + ... + PN) / N || PX = price of index X
ema: Exponential moving average applies weighting factors for previous values and current which decrease exponentially. Usualy used for unstable moving charts.
tma: Triangualr moving average is a simple moving average of a simple moving average, so basically mean of n previous means of previous x data. FORMULA: TMA = (SMA1 + SMA2 + SMA3 + SMA4 + ... SMAN) / N || SMAX = Simple moving average of index X
wma: Weighted moving average works as weighted mean of the previous n data. The data are weighted descending from the current value.
bob: Bollinger Bands charaterize volatility and the prices of each data in chart. Bollinger bands shows relative high and low prices of a market fo each data. By definition, prices are high at the upper band and low at the lower band.
